newsitem.title: CROATIA: HUNGARY, CROATIA DISCUSS FREE TRADE ZONE, PIPELINE.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY, CROATIA DISCUSS FREE TRADE ZONE, PIPELINE.

text.p: Hungary discussed with Croatia on Wednesday its plans to buy shares in Croatia's Adriatic pipeline and to have a free-trade zone at the Adriatic port of Rijeka, state news agency HINA reported.

Hungarian Industry and Trade Minister Szabolcs Fazakas met Croatia's ambassador in Budapest Zdenko Skrabalo to review economic cooperation and ways to boost Hungary's investments in Croatia, HINA said.
They talked about "a free-trade zone for Hungary in Rijeka and state oil company MOL's intention to buy 12.5 percent of the Adriatic pipeline shares," the agency said.
Fazakas invited two key ministers to come to Budapest for talks before the end of the year.

Economy minister Davor Stern is in charge of free-trade zones and Privatisation Minister Ivan Penic controls the selloff of state-owned companies, including the pipeline. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
